definition: to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions

sentences.english: One he can hang if the friend's father should displease him?
sentences.chinese: 一個當她父親觸怒他的時候可以被吊死的朋友？

sentences.english: His address gave umbrage to the authorities.
Your aggressive promoting of philosophic or religious viewpoints may antagonize others.
sentences.chinese: 你的衝動促進哲學性或宗教觀點可能會觸怒他人。

sentences.english: His manner was abrupt to the point of rudeness.
sentences.chinese: 他的粗率無禮的舉止觸怒了她。

sentences.english: "I didn't set out to offend anyone, " explained the 29-year-old.
sentences.chinese: “我無意觸怒任何人，”29歲的前鋒解釋道。

sentences.english: The social consequences could be disastrous, and could give political hard-liners a leg up.
sentences.chinese: 其社會後果可能是災難性的，同時會觸怒強硬派分子。

sentences.english: He felt deeply affronted at her rudeness.
sentences.chinese: 他深爲她的粗野所觸怒。

sentences.english: She was offended by his abrupt manner.
sentences.chinese: 他的粗率無禮的舉止觸怒了她。

sentences.english: But this was a challenge hurled in the face of Almighty God. Belshazzar had reached P.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他這個狂妄的舉動大大觸怒了全能的真神。

sentences.english: Those in his employ were careful never to enrage him.
sentences.chinese: 在他手底下幹活的人都非常小心絕不去觸怒他。

sentences.english: The man's familiar behavior angered the woman.
sentences.chinese: 這男子放肆的行爲觸怒了這位婦女。

sentences.english: Her insolence greatly displeased the judge.
sentences.chinese: 她傲慢無禮，大大地觸怒了法官。

sentences.english: It is impolitic to offend people who can help you.
sentences.chinese: 觸怒能幫助你的人是很失策的。

sentences.english: Fly-in ads are derivatives of pop-ups which are also equally irking to the visitors.
sentences.chinese: 飛在瘡疤衍生流行起坐也是同樣觸怒了參觀者。

sentences.english: Indeed, the station seems more concerned with not offending the government.
sentences.chinese: 相反，這家電臺更爲擔心的是不要觸怒政府。

definition: to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
